title.value: From Precision Medicine to Precision Convergence for Multilevel Resilience—The Aging Brain and Its Social Isolation
title.justification: The title clearly identifies the paper as focusing on the concept of "Precision Convergence" for enhancing resilience in the context of aging and social isolation, building upon precision medicine.
title.quote: Dubé L, Silveira PP, Nielsen DE, Moore S, Paquet C, Cisneros-Franco JM, Kemp G, Knauper B, Ma Y, Khan M, Bartlett-Esquilant G, Evans AC, Fellows LK, Armony JL, Spreng RN, Nie J-Y, Brown ST, Northoff G and Bzdok D (2022) From Precision Medicine to Precision Convergence for Multilevel Resilience—The Aging Brain and Its Social Isolation. Front. Public Health 10:720117. doi: 10.3389/fpubh.2022.720117

extractions.description: This paper proposes the concept of precision convergence as a framework to enhance multilevel resilience, especially in the context of aging and social isolation. It elaborates on the interplay of biological, social, and technological factors in fostering individual and societal resilience, drawing lessons from the COVID-19 pandemic response.

type.justification: The paper presents a conceptual framework of 'precision convergence' and discusses its potential applications rather than performing experimental or empirical investigations.
type.quote: Precision Convergence is an integrative governance framework that embeds ethical, social and privacy concerns into science, technology, innovation, and policy.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on enhancing resilience in the context of aging and social isolation, which aligns with public health concerns.
name.quote: This article was submitted to Aging and Public Health, a section of the journal Frontiers in Public Health

name.justification: The paper builds on the advancements in precision medicine to propose a broader framework termed precision convergence.
name.quote: The pandemic has also emphasized the importance of precision medicine, a convergence between clinical, genomics, and computational sciences.

name.justification: The paper discusses neurobiological systems, brain structure, and cognitive reserve as integral parts of individual resilience.
name.quote: These are emergent properties of neurobiological systems that underlie one’s reflexes, impulses, emotions, and cognitions, which are continuously weighted and re-weighted for adaptive behavior.

name.justification: The paper references UK Biobank as a crucial resource in integrating data for studying brain structure and societal behaviors.
name.quote: Consider, for instance, the UK Biobank, the premier “big data” resource that links genotyping, phenotyping and contextual information on ∼500,000 individuals, making it possible to overcome this unbridgeable brain-to-society gap.
